newsitem.title: BRAZIL: SOCCER-FLAMENGO WANT TO LURE CANTONA OUT OF RETIREMENT.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-FLAMENGO WANT TO LURE CANTONA OUT OF RETIREMENT.

text.p: Flamengo, Brazil's most popular club, said on Thursday they were hoping to lure former French international Eric Cantona out of retirement.
"We are interested in signing Cantona," said Flamengo vice-president Michel Assef, whose club is searching for a player to replace Romario.
Cantona announced at the end of last season he was abandoning the game after helping Manchester United to their fourth premier league title in five years.
Assef said Flamengo president Kleber Leite, who is in Europe, hoped to meet Cantona but could not say if he had set up a meeting with the volatile Frenchman or even if he knew where Cantona was.
Romario's loan from Spanish club Valencia ran out on Sunday.
Sao Paulo attempted to sign Cantona when he was serving a ban for lunging at a fan with a karate-style kick during a game at Crystal Palace but were told the suspension applied worldwide.
